alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Carroll (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 12:55PM EDT until May 27 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT FOR EASTERN CARROLL AND NORTHWESTERN BALTIMORE COUNTIES... At 1255 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Manchester to near Hampstead to near Randallstown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Cockeysville, Eldersburg, Reisterstown, Hampstead, Manchester, Oakland, Gamber, Finksburg, Carrollton, Upperco, Freeland, Louisville, Bentley Springs, Phoenix, Jacksonville, Butler, Monkton, Glencoe, Lineboro and Hunt Valley. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for northern and north central Maryland. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern Maryland. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
